Summary Accomplished Senior Software Manager with extraordinary combination of large complex program management, technical management and people management skills. Hands on expertise in SW development, SW architecture and SW content management. Over ten years of experience in wireless industry and SW development in multiple mobile platforms. Proven track record of meeting and exceeding schedules with high quality SW deliveries for product programs for multiple carriers and regions globally. Always setting high goals and looking for opportunities for personal growth and improvements. 
 
- Experienced in leading major SW/HW platforms to mass markets.  
- Ability to manage programs over multiple time zones in rapidly changing environment while working with people and teams from diverse backgrounds including external suppliers and partners.  
- Experience in driving results in complex big company as well as agile startup type environments. - Ability to manage and lead programs throughout entire SW development life cycle from product definition to final stabilization and commercialization phases to deliver high quality SW for product programs.  
- Capability to bring mobile devices into both US and international markets through in-depth knowledge of operator technical requirements.  
- Effective communication skills in writing and verbal to report status, resolve issues and conflicting priorities.  
- Ability to quickly comprehend complex technical issues. Persistent, self-driven and motivated by challenges. Summary Innovator, result oriented leader with extensive experience in technical senior management, engineering program management (Platform, Software, Firmware, Hardware), product development (custom/ASIC), Corporate Life Cycles, product management and business strategies. Proven track record in problem solving, creating comprehensive strategies, developing high-performing and result oriented teams. High performing manager with positive employee feedbacks, great attention to employee career development and training. Direct involvement in resource allocation and hiring. Lead cross discipline and global engineering teams.  
 
Shahram has BS (Magna Cum Laude), MSEE in Electrical Engineering from University of Minnesota as well as MBA from University of California Davis. He hold 9 patents. He has been one of the authors for computer engineering handbook (first and second edition). He completed his MBA from UC Davis in June 2008 with emphasis in Finance and Marketting. He has also taken UC Berkelety Intel Executive Leadership Development Program in 2007 which were offered to selective Intel senior management.  
 
Shahram has been involved in community volunteering activities his entire career. He has volunteered in different organizations such as Leukemia Lymphoma Society , Sacred Heart Community, Family Giving Tree, etc. He has been volutneering for Leukemia Lymphoma society since summer of 2004. He has acted as a mentor in the organization helping participants to acheive their fundraising goals, understand mission/goal of organization as well as train and complete what is often their first marathon. 
 
Shahram enjoys travalling, meeting people and experiencing different cultures. He has travelled to 22 countries and over 100+ different cities. He also enjoys running and exercising. Summary Motivated, ambitious and professional team-player with a diverse background in operations, engineering, and service roles excelling at connecting people to solutions. Desire to learn, be challenged, and lead clients to success by helping businesses and people build productive lives.  
 
Experience: 
- Develop, launch and manufacture electro-mechanical products through prototype builds into high-volume manufacturing. 
- Organize and manage program schedules, tasks and budgets involving dynamic priorities and commitments. 
- Develop Assessments and Drive Direction directly with internal and external stakeholders through Effective and Appropriate Communication Channels. 
- Build and foster Internal and External Customer/Supplier Relationships through managing a complex portfolio of deliverables as well as sharing life and business experiences. 
- Clearly Communicate Technical Information to technical and non-technical team members and stakeholders daily.  
- Mentor and Coach college interns, recent college graduates and senior level employees to achieve their best.  
 
 
Goals: 
- Develop products and services that help people, groups and companies build productive lives that help others, utilizing their strengths and providing opportunities to grow. 
- Interface directly with customers, internal and external. 
- Continuously learn, grow, and be challenged with differentiated issues. 
- Build leadership competencies.
